org.gserve.model

Class GroovyScript

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gserve.model.GroovyScript

  • public class GroovyScript
extends java.lang.Object
    Object modeling a created, scheduled or unscheduled, class of groovy code to be executed by the server.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GroovyScript(int id, java.lang.String className, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String code, java.lang.String created, java.lang.String creator, java.lang.String changed, boolean isScheduled, java.lang.String schedule, java.lang.String lastExecution)
      Constructs a groovy script with all fields.
      GroovyScript(java.lang.String className, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String code, java.lang.String created, java.lang.String creator, java.lang.String changed, boolean isScheduled, java.lang.String schedule, java.lang.String lastExecution)
      Constructs a GroovyScript with all fields excepting Id (the database primary key).

      void setSchedule(java.lang.String schedule)
      Sets the schedule of the GroovyScript.
      void unschedule()
      If this instance of the GroovyScript is scheduled for execution, un-schedules the GroovyScript from further automatic execution.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GroovyScript

        public GroovyScript(int id,
                    java.lang.String className,
                    java.lang.String description,
                    java.lang.String code,
                    java.lang.String created,
                    java.lang.String creator,
                    java.lang.String changed,
                    boolean isScheduled,
                    java.lang.String schedule,
                    java.lang.String lastExecution)
        Constructs a groovy script with all fields.
        Parameters:
        id - GroovyScript's database primary key.
        className - GroovyScript's main class.
        description - Description of the GroovyScript.
        code - Groovy code that comprises the GroovyScript.
        created - Date of creation of the GroovyScript.
        creator - Application user who crated the GroovyScript.
        changed - Date of application change.
        isScheduled - Is GroovyScript scheduled, "Yes", or "No".
        schedule - GroovyScript's execution schedule.
        lastExecution - GroovyScript's last date and time of execution.

      • GroovyScript

        public GroovyScript(java.lang.String className,
                    java.lang.String description,
                    java.lang.String code,
                    java.lang.String created,
                    java.lang.String creator,
                    java.lang.String changed,
                    boolean isScheduled,
                    java.lang.String schedule,
                    java.lang.String lastExecution)
        Constructs a GroovyScript with all fields excepting Id (the database primary key).
        Parameters:
        className - GroovyScript's main class.
        description - Description of the GroovyScript.
        code - Groovy code that comprises the GroovyScript.
        created - Date of creation of the GroovyScript.
        creator - Application user who crated the GroovyScript.
        changed - Date of application change.
        isScheduled - Is GroovyScript scheduled, "Yes", or "No".
        schedule - GroovyScript's execution schedule.
        lastExecution - GroovyScript's last date and time of execution.

        public boolean isScheduled()
        Method to check if a GroovyScript is currently scheduled for execution.
        Returns:

      • getById

        public static GroovyScript getById(int id)
        Returns a GroovyScript object from its database primary key.
        Parameters:
        id - Primary key of GroovyScript to get.
        Returns:
        GroovyScript with given primary key, or null if one does not exist.

      • unschedule

        public void unschedule()
        If this instance of the GroovyScript is scheduled for execution, un-schedules the GroovyScript from further automatic execution.

      • isCron

        public boolean isCron()
        Returns true if the GroovyScript is currently scheduled to be executed with a Cron Trigger
        Returns:
        True is GroovyScript uses a cron expression in its schedule.

      • getByClassName

        public static GroovyScript getByClassName(java.lang.String className)
        Retrieves a GroovyScript object from the database using "Class Name" as the criteria for the search. Will return at most one GroovyScript.
        Parameters:
        className - Input class name of GroovyScript to get.
        Returns:
        GroovyScript object with specified class name. Returns no more than one object.

      • findActive

        public static java.util.List<GroovyScript> findActive()
        Returns a java.util.List of GroovyScripts that are currently scheduled.
        Returns:
        List of GroovyScripts that are scheduled.
